Define what it means for a polynomial to have a root of multiplicity greater than 1.
Substitute x = -1 into the polynomial and its derivatives to set up equations.
Since x = -1 is a root with multiplicity greater than 1, equate the polynomial and its first derivative to zero when x = -1.
Solve the derived equations simultaneously to find the value of a.

Use the results from steps 2 and 5 to determine a value of a such that x = -1 is a root of multiplicity more than 1.

Compute the first derivative of the polynomial, which is the derivative with respect to x.
Substitute x = -1 into the derived expression to set up the condition for -1 to be a repeated root.
Solve the system of equations obtained from steps 2 and 4 to find the value of a.
Verify that the calculated a value indeed results in -1 being a root of multiplicity greater than 1 for the polynomial.
